description:
Before there was Tooru and Kyou – there was Katsuya and Kyouko. Discover the turbulent beginning of Tooru’s mom’s dark past, and the man who breathed new hope into her. Watch the evolution of their love story and the birth of the Honda family, as this chapter completes the full adaptation of the heartwarming Fruits Basket story.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
hashtag: #フルーツバスケット #フルバ
synonyms: The Story of Kyoko and Katsuya

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Parenthood
tags.description: Centers around the experience of raising a child.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/n_takaya77)

Natsuki Takaya is a Japanese manga artist best known for creating the series Fruits Basket.

Takaya was born and raised in Tokyo, where she made her debut as a manga artist in 1992. Takaya is left handed and had wanted to be a manga artist since first grade, when her sister started drawing.

__Awards:__
* 2001: Kodansha Manga Award, Shojo : _Fruits Basket_

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

__Graduated:__ Kunitachi College of Music (Department of Composition)

[Artist Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/masaruyokoyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaruyokoyama)

**Yokoyama Masaru** is a Japanese composer, arranger, keyboardist and programmer affiliated with Miracle Bus.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__Real Name:__ Yoshinori Oohashi
__Birth Place:__ Chiba, Japan

_Note: Not to be confused with the [digital artist](https://anilist.co/staff/220888/)._

Takaya was born and raised in Tokyo, where she made her debut as a manga artist in 1992. Takaya is left handed and had wanted to be a manga artist since first grade, when her sister started drawing.
